Summary: SC 1.4.25 Snow patches mostly stable, isolated wet snow instabilities on NE, E, SE asp above 950m during the day. Aval Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Good visibility  Winds approx 10mph or less
Comment: Dominant high pressure bringing settle weather and warm temperatures.
WeatherInfluences: The winds will be fresh Southerlies, gaining in strength to become very strong during the afternoon. Dry, with no precipitation expected and the freezing level will be above the highest summits.
SnowStability: The remaining snow patches will continue to thaw and consolidate and be stable. The greatest accumulations persist in steep terrain mostly on North-West to North-East aspects above 950 metres. Isolated wet snow instabilities will develop during the day on steep sun affected slopes with coire rims and gully tops being most affected. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mild and dry day with extended periods of sunshine. The winds were moderate South-Westerlies and the freezing level above the highest summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining snow patches continue to thaw, diminish and are generally firm and stable throughout. The greatest accumulations are found on steep coire rims and gully tops on North-West to North-East aspects above 950 metres. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: GC for 1/4/25. The remaining snow will continue to thaw and consolidate. Stability will be good in all locations. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Wet snow throughout. Poor visibility in bands of cloud. Winds 10 - 20 mph.
Comment: Dry, mild, settled weather forecast for the rest of the week.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry with strong South-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be well above the summits.
SnowStability: The remaining snow will continue to thaw and consolidate. Stability will be good in all locations. Greatest amounts will remain on North to East aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: There was some rain and drizzle, mainly in the morning. Moderate South-Westerly winds. The freezing level was above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The wet snow cover continues to thaw and consolidate. Stability is good in all locations. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: LO for 1/4. Mild and dry. Snowpack slowly thawing, generally stable. Few unstable sections of cornice above 1100m. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Wet snow throughout.  Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells in the glens.  Winds 20-30 mph.
Comment: Nice weather expected the next few days.
WeatherInfluences: A pleasant warm and dry spring day with a fair amount of sunshine is expected. The freezing level will be well above the summits.
SnowStability: The snowpack will continue to slowly thaw and consolidate. Stability will be generally good throughout. A few sections of slumping and unstable cornices will remain above North and East aspects above 1100 metres. However these will not be large. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A mild and cloudy day with some light rain from time to time. The freezing level was well above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is wet and is slowly thawing and consolidating. Some sections of cornice, mainly found above North to East aspects above 1100 metres, are slumping, and prone to collapse. However, these sections of cornice are not large or  extensive. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: TO for 1.4 Currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change.
SnowDistribution: Very limited patchy snow. Cloud base was mainly around 700m. Winds 20-30 mph.
Comment: Remaining settled for a few days.
WeatherInfluences: It is expected to be dry, with the freezing level well above all summits. Winds will be very strong generally Southerly, easing during the day.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a mild day, with the freezing level above all summits. Light precipitation fell as rain at all levels. Winds were strong South-South-Westerly.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: NC for 01/04 Snow patches remain on high N through E to SE aspects. Avalanche hazard will be Low.
SnowDistribution: Winds approx 10 - 20 mph fresh.  Good visibility.  Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground.
Comment: Settled high pressure weather dominates for the rest of the week bringing dry, warm and sunny conditions. Rock fall a potential hazard during the prolonged thaw.
WeatherInfluences: Strong Southerly winds. No precipitation forecast and a dry, clear and sunny day is expected. The freezing level will be well above the highest summits.
SnowStability: Little change is expected. Snow patches will remain on corrie rims, steep corrie headwalls and high plateau areas,  with deepest accumulations on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters. These remaining snow patches will continue to diminish and will be well bonded and stable throughout. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Fresh Westerly winds. A clear, dry and sunny day with good visibility. The freezing level was well above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: Areas of snow remain. Primarily located on corrie rims, steep corrie headwalls and high plateau areas. The snow pack gained most depth on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters. The snowpack continues to diminish and is well bonded and stable throughout. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: CM for 1.3: Very patchy snowpack. Residual cornices are wet and prone to collapse. Low Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground. Cloud base was at 1000 metres for most of the morning. Winds 10 - 20 mph with stronger gusts.
Comment: Very patchy snowpack. Residual cornices will be wet and prone to collapse during the thaw. Rockfall also a consideration when in the vicinity of steep crags.
WeatherInfluences: Mild and dry throughout. Periods of warm sunshine anticipated during the day.
SnowStability: The very patchy snowpack will continue to thaw and will remain well stabilised in all locations. Additional snow loss anticipated by the end of the day. Some potential for the collapse of residual minor cornices that overhang a few selected steep North to East aspects.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Mild at all altitudes with periods of light drizzle during the day.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is composed of moist thawing snow patches, as low as 800m in a few locations, which are well stabilised. Small, weak cornices remain above a few North to East aspects. Recent cornice debris litters the base of Bellevue Buttress in Coire Ardair.  The avalanche hazard is Low.
